feed.title: This week, I learned – weeknotes by Mo Morgan

entry.title: Weeknote 0006
entry.summary: A slog of a week. One of those ones that felt about nine days long. Not always a bad thing, though. Another unsuccessful house-hunt at the weekend. Couldn’t get in to see the one I’m sure is probably the best candidate so far. Another was…

entry.title: Weeknote 0005
entry.summary: I now have an NHS dentist that works Saturdays! Never had much luck with dental administration, either finding them available or them honouring my appointments, so being able to go on a weekend appointment feels like a special thing. Therefore, I went for an inspection…

entry.title: Weeknote 0004
entry.summary: A long old trip to a clients’ site on Monday: a seven-hour round trip by rail. Up early, home late. A good day, though. And I’ve learned there’s no such thing as train-grade wifi anymore. Some appauling, others practically as good as home. And there…

entry.title: Weeknote 0003
entry.summary: Went househunting. No matter how carefully you study the listings and photos, you never know what awaits you. Perhaps I was seduced by the Rightmove ad: soft, twinkling sunlight streaming in as soft, twinkling piano music plays on. But I certainly wasn’t prepared for the…

entry.title: Weeknote 0002
entry.summary: A thought about weeknotes, why they’d be valuable for agencies and yet why they’ll never adopt them, follows below. So I’ve been doing a bunch of research in recent weeks into the automotive market and its aspirations to move from product manufacture to service provider.
